Phase 7 complete: Message History & Replay implemented

Implemented comprehensive message history management, replay functionality,
and retention policies for controlling database growth.

Features Added:

1. Statistics Dashboard \(Statistics.tsx\)
   - Real-time statistics with automatic refresh
   - Overview metrics: total messages, unique topics, msg/sec, data volume
   - Top 10 topic distribution with visual progress bars
   - Activity summary showing recent message rate
   - Storage usage analysis with average bytes per message
   - Formatted byte display \(Bytes, KB, MB, GB\)
   - Clean, card-based UI with color-coded statistics

2. Message Replay \(MessageReplay.tsx\)
   - Load messages from database history \(configurable 1-1000\)
   - Two replay modes:
     * Preserve original timing \(uses actual message intervals\)
     * Fixed speed replay \(0.5x, 1x, 2x, 5x, 10x\)
   - Full playback controls: play, pause, stop, resume
   - Real-time progress bar with percentage
   - Republishes messages to MQTT broker with original QoS/retained flags
   - Status indicators showing current message being replayed
   - Automatic completion with success notification

3. Retention Policy \(RetentionPolicy.tsx\)
   - Configure automatic message cleanup policies
   - Settings: max message count, max age in days
   - Enable/disable policy enforcement
   - Manual cleanup buttons:
     * Clear messages older than 1, 7, or 30 days
     * Clear all messages \(with confirmation\)
   - Current message count display
   - Policy settings saved to localStorage
   - Confirmation dialogs for destructive actions

Integration:
- Added all three components to App.tsx when connected
- Layout: MessageReplay and Statistics side-by-side
- Retention Policy in full-width row below
- Updated phase progress indicator to show Phase 7 complete

UI/UX Enhancements:
- Consistent card-based design matching existing components
- Alert boxes explaining component functionality
- Loading states and error handling
- Color-coded statistics \(green for messages, blue for topics, etc.\)
- Progress bars for topic distribution visualization
- Formatted numbers with thousand separators
